Key Arguments: The proposed legislation will stifle free speech, which is a fundamental human right.
The definition of 'misinformation' is too subjective, particularly regarding what constitutes 'harm'.
The bill will create a climate of fear, discouraging open communication and progress.
There is a trend of increasing restrictions on speech in Australia, and this bill exacerbates that trend.
Notable Quotes: My offspring will be committed to crawling into a cave where they communicate with no one for fear of ever saying a word out of place if this becomes law.
Free speech is a non-negotiable human right and must be safeguarded.
It is simply not possible for governments to police such subjectivity.
